articles.author: Ben Turner
articles.title: Melting glaciers could trigger volcanic eruptions around the globe, study finds - Live Science
articles.description: Glacial melt could increase volcanic activity in North America, New Zealand and Russia, spewing greenhouse gases into the atmosphere.
articles.content:
Melting glaciers could make volcanic eruptions more explosive and frequent, worsening climate change in the process, scientists have warned.
Hundreds of volcanoes

articles.title: 200 million year-old jawbone revealed as new species - BBC
articles.description: The newly discovered flying reptile is the oldest pterosaur in North America.
articles.content:
Victoria GillScience correspondent, BBC News
The new pterosaur has been named Eotephradactylus mcintireae, meaning 'ash-winged dawn goddess'
